data.text: “It is true that there are places where men dig to find silver,
People dig iron ore out of the ground,
Men use lamps while they work far down under the ground
They dig ◄shafts/narrow holes very deep down into the ground► in places that are far from where people live,
Food grows on the surface of the ground,
The stones that are dug from under the ground contain ◄sapphires/very valuable blue stones►,
Some birds have very good eyes,
Lions or other proud wild animals have not walked on the roads near those mines.
Miners tear apart [MTY] very hard rock;
They cut tunnels through the rocks,
They dam up small streams in order that water does not flow,
“But wisdom: Where can people find that?
Humans do not know where to find it;
It is as though water that is deep inside the earth and water that is in the seas say [PRS],
People cannot buy wisdom
Wisdom is worth much more than fine gold from Ophir land
It is worth much more than gold or beautiful glass,
Wisdom is worth more than coral or crystal/pure quartz;
The prices of ◄topaz/very valuable yellow stones► from Ethiopia and of pure gold
“So, where does wisdom come from?
No living humans can see it [MTY];
It is as though the places where people go after they die say [PRS],
God is the only one who knows how to find wisdom;
because he can see things even in the most remote/distant places on the earth;
When he decided how strongly the winds should blow,
and when he decided where rain should fall,
at that time he saw wisdom and decided that it is extremely valuable.
And then he said to humans, ‘Listen! To have an awesome respect for me is what will enable you to become wise;
